title.narrative: Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program 2017-2021
Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program 2017-2021

description.narrative:
Insatsen syftar på att förbättra sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa i Bangladesh och är direkt kopplad till rättighets- och fattigdomsperspektivet. Insatsen ligger också i linje med de prioriteringarna i den svenska resultatstrategin med Bangladesh och inkluderar de fyra principerna om deltagande, icke-diskriminering, öppenhet och ansvarsutkrävande på ett tillfredsställande sätt.
Ambassaden bedömer att insatsen är relevant för svenskt stöd då det inkluderar mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet mellan kvinnor och män som är de tematiska prioriteringar för svenskt utvecklingssamarbete. De identifierade indikatorerna bedöms vara realistiska och mätbara. Utbredd korruption, utmaningar kring projektets hållbarhet genom avsaknad av potentiella givare och växande religiösa känslor bedöms som de stora riskerna med programmet.
Som riskreducerande åtgärder måste RHSTEP ta itu med de rekommendationer som identifierats i analysen om kapacitetsbedömning, bl. a. för att minimera de interna riskerna i samband med programmet. För att minska den externa risken kommer RHSTEP att ytterligare förbättra relationen med ministeriet, gemenskapen och andra relevanta intressenter. Dessa kommer att följas upp genom dialog. Programmet kommer att kontinuerligt följas upp av ambassaden. Utfasningen av stödet till RHSTEP från Sverige sker under angiven tidsperiod. Utvärderings sker mid-term.

The purpose of the project is to contribute in reduction of Maternal Mortality, morbidity from unsafe abortion and improve the Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR) situation of women and adolescents in the Project areas.
This project targets to achieve 152825 MR conducted , 38910 patient managed for Complications of unsafe abortion , distribution of 367716 FP methods , 155986 individual received Reproductive Health service at school, community and garments, Institutionalized and sustainable attention at the national level to ensure access to safe abortion and family planning.
This will be achieved by ensuring that poor and marginalized women and adolescents don't face any financial barrier to access safe MR and modern Family Planning (FP) methods; Providing comprehensive MR and PAC training to health service providers, raising awareness and creation of Demand of SRHR and Supporting Changes in the policy environments for abortion services. SRHR project will help Bangladesh to achieve universal health coverage (SDG 3), by ensuring safe MR services, increasing family planning use and reducing maternal mortality in Bangladesh and creating enabling Environment to exercise sexual reproductive Health and rights.

The overall objective of the project is to contribute in reduction of Maternal Mortality, morbidity from unsafe abortion and improve the SRHR situation of women and adolescents in the project areas. There are 7 outcomes described in the Project. Outcome-1: Improved Skills of Service providers for SRHR services.; Outcome-2: Improved capacity of the consortium in SRHR program management.. Outcome-3: Increased access to quality SRHR services for women, adolescents and men; Outcome-4: Enhanced knowledge of the women and adolescents in the project areas to make informed choice pertaining to their sexual and reproductive health needs; Outcome-5: Strengthened monitoring, Research, Evaluation and Documentation processes in the consortium. Outcome-6: Strengthened advocacy and social networking initiatives for improving SRHR situation. Outcome-7: Sustainability of the consortium improved. During the entire project period it aims to achieve 152825 MR conducted , 38910 patient managed for complications of unsafe abortion , distribution of 367716 FP methods , 155986 individual received reproductive health education and service at school, community and garments, Institutionalized and sustainable attention at the national level to ensure access to safe abortion and family planning.

participating-org.narrative: RHSTEP/Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program
RHSTEP/Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program

sector.narrative: Personnel development for population and reproductive health

tag.narrative: 3.1 - By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.
3.1 - Till 2030 minska mödradödligheten i världen till mindre än 70 dödsfall per 100 000 förlossningar med levande barn.

3.2 - By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births.

3.2 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att inga spädbarn eller barn under fem år dör av orsaker som hade kunnat förebyggas. Alla länder bör sträva efter att minska den neonatala dödligheten till högst tolv dödsfall per 1 000 levande födda och dödligheten bland barn under fem år till högst 25 dödsfall per 1 000 levande födda.

3.7 - By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes.

3.7 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla har tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsovård, inklusive familjeplanering, information och utbildning, och att reproduktiv hälsa integreras i nationella strategier och program.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.

5.6 - Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.

5.6 - Säkerställa allmän tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och reproduktiva rättigheter i enlighet med överenskommelserna i handlingsprogrammet från den internationella konferensen om befolkning och utveckling, Pekingplattformen samt slutdokumenten från respektive översynskonferenser.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Decision on amendment of Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program 2017-2021

description.narrative:
During the reporting period, the consortium has imparted training to 134 service providers which is 103% of the yearly target. Among them 82 FWVs, Paramedics, Nurses/SACMOs received three-week long comprehensive MR, MRM and PAC training from RHSTEP and 42 service providers received a weeklong refresher training from RHSTEP and BAPSA.
During this reporting period, the consortium has rendered 499028(83%) services among 285,356 clients. RHSTEP served 218431 clients with 402553(92%) services and BAPSA served 66925 clients with 96475 (59%) services respectively.
Total 32,813 (91%) clients were supported from RHSTEP and 15,608 (47%) clients were aided from BAPSA centers. Among all the contraceptive acceptors, non-MR contraceptive acceptors were more in number and number of post MR contraceptive acceptors was also equally high due to proper counseling and psychological support from the consortium clinics.
During this ongoing pandemic, safe motherhood service is a priority more than ever because the pregnant mothers are one of the risk groups of COVID-19. Safe motherhood services including antenatal care, delivery service and post-natal care services were provided to 26,566 (94%) women in the final year of the project. During the services, safety precautions were maintained thoroughly to ensure the safety of the clients. RHSTEP served 14,058 (103%) clients during this period and BAPSA supported 12,508 (85%) clients respectively.
Due to the emergence of covid-19, the awareness raising activities took a very different shape that involves less number of audience at a time. Along with RTI/STIs, management of Obstetric and gynecological cases were also tackled by the consortium with highest dedication.
Total, 18,246 (64%) RTI/STI and OBs/GYN cases were managed during the mentioned timeline. In this project year, the consortium has rendered 24,183 (95%) reproductive organ cancer diagnostic and counseling service to the clients in catchment areas. For early detection of cancer of cervix, 3813 (73%) Pap smear and VIA test was performed along with 2041 follow-up. On the other hand, 2,389 bimanual breast cancer screening test were executed along with 12,550 counseling from the consortium service points.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
